poem:
### The Imperfect Image

In this pixelated dawn,  
Where AI's brush falters,  
The boy runs without hands,  
Over grass that levitates;  
Half a truth is captured  
In the lens of tomorrow—  
Figures made of dreams,  
Yet tethered by their absence,  
A future sketched in flaws,  
Handcrafted by the inhuman.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s happening fast’ – creative workers and professionals share their fears and hopes about the rise of AI Oliver Fiegel, a 47-year-old photographer based in Munich, was reading a German national Sunday newspaper recently when he saw a front-page image that looked strangely off. The image showed a boy chasing a football on a pitch. But some of the wildflowers on the grass floated without stems. Half the goal net was missing. The boy’s hands". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
